item.title: No More Room In Hell 2: All Starting Classes & Their Abilities
item.description:
Survival is everything in No More Room In Hell 2 , as losing your life on the game's enormous map means starting your next run with a brand-new character. As such, it's important to consider all options when choosing your next character class, even if your options are limited, and find your fellow Responders as soon as possible.

With each new run, players will be given a selection of characters to choose from, each in a different class. The limitation to this is that you won't know the character's starting skill until you pick them, so this article will shed some light on all character classes in No More Room In Hell 2 and their starting skills , so you can pick the best option to suit your playstyle.

This article was written shortly after the launch of No More Room In Hell 2 's early access. More characters may be introduced, so let us know in the comments if you find one that we're missing!

All Classes & Their Starting Abilities in No More Room In Hell 2

At the time of writing this, there are a total of 26 different character classes in No More Room In Hell 2 , each with their own starting abilities. While you'll only have the choice between three when you start a new run, little information is given about how these classes differ, particularly when it comes to their skillset. The table below will shed some light on what each class has to offer and give you a better chance of securing those valuable extractions:

Class Name

Ability Name

Description

Army Reservist

Hellfire

Increased hip-fire accuracy with rifles

Baseball Rookie

Hard Blow

More stagger damage from two-handed melee attacks

Bear Hunter

Penetrating Shot

Heavy shots penetrate more targets

Coast Guard Veteran

Limbo

You survive longer when down

Courier

Mule

Increased backpack capacity

Deer Hunter

Quiet Steps

Reduced noice from movement

Deputy

Tight Shot

Shotgun pellets have reduced spread

Desginated Marksman

Steel Chamber

Heavy rifles deal increased damage

Detective

Headblown

Handguns deal increased headshot damage

Engineer

Longer Battery

Greater lifespan for flashlight batteries

Football MVP

Adrenaline Rush

At critical health, you consume no stamina

Hockey Player

Rush

Two-handed heavy melee attacks use less stamina

Lumberjack

Headhunter

Increased melee headshot damage

Marine Veteran

Steady Shot

Crouching enhances rifle precision and reduces recoil

Martial Arts Master

Heavy Shoves

Shoving deals damage

MMA Fighter

Sturdy Body

Reduced damage from attacks

Nurse

Skilled Medic

Heal yourself and others faster

Police Sniper

Eagle Eye

Damage falloff on heavy rifles is reduced

Prepper

Scavenger

Increased ammo from pickups

Quartermaster

Vulture

Larger ammo stacks

Rescue Specialist

Healing Item Stack

Carry more medical items per stack

Sheriff

Overkill

Shotguns fire more pellets

Sous Chef

Butcher

Easier to dismember zombies

Spinal Surgeon

Hitman

One-handed melee attacks consume more stamina but do more damage

Swim Captain

Thick Skin

Increased maximum health

Track Star

Athlete

Increased stamina

Which Class Should You Pick?

Your options are limited when starting a new run in No More Room In Hell 2 , as you're only given three choices that are randomly picked from the pool. Recommendations could be made on which ones would be the strongest for starting from scratch, but statistically, it is unlikely that you'll have them as one of your options. In saying that, you can certainly build a character that suits your playstyle, whether you prefer stealth, firepower, strength, survivability, or resourcefulness, or you can play with friends that have different skills and feed off each other's strengths.

While these skills are linked to each of their respective character classes, that doesn't mean they'll be unavailable for the rest of the characters in the game. As you earn XP and level up your character, you'll be given another three options to choose from the pool of skills. The key to creating a character that fits your playstyle is to gather those resources and successfully be extracted from the map, so you can continue to strengthen your loadout with each run.

How To Change Character in No More Room in Hell 2

Unfortunately, it is not possible for players to change their character in the traditional sense in a run of No More Room In Hell 2 . However, that's not to say that it isn't possible, but it will require sacrificing any progress you have made with your current character and intentionally dying. So, if you're looking to make a change, then it would be best to do so when you're in the early stages of your run.

No More Room In Hell 2 has a permadeath feature which, as the name may suggest, means that when your character dies, that is the end of your run. While you can be healed or revived by a teammate during a match, there's no option to respawn, so once you're gone, that's it. This also applies to exiting a game early - if you exit to the main menu or desktop before a mission is complete, your character is considered dead and you'll need to start again.

item.title: Best Cities In The Persona Games, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Persona games blend traditional JRPG with life sim elements, setting in modern Japan or fictional urban areas.
  • Persona 5 Strikers takes fans on a road trip to explore various iconic Japanese cities, adding a twist to familiar areas.
  • Each city explored in different Persona games, from Sapporo to Kyoto, offers unique charm and memorable moments.

Persona is one of the most popular JRPG franchises of all time. The games served as spinoffs of the mainline Shin Megami Tensei series before the third entry integrated some revolutionary changes that helped Persona stand out as a brilliant combination of traditional JRPG and life sim elements.

These games take place in the modern world and are either set in Japan's cities or take place in fictional locations inspired by the many iconic areas in Japan. This allows players to explore urban landscapes rife with Japanese culture, to the point where they can double as a virtual tour of sorts.

8 Sapporo

The Largest City In Hokkaido

Persona 5 Strikers is a love letter to fans of the original game who want to embark on more adventures with the Phantom Thieves. This lets them explore a bunch of fun locations on a road trip as they try to uncover another conspiracy after getting their powers back.

Out of the many locations players explore in Persona 5 Strikers , Sapporo is relatively lean on content but is still jam-packed with fun locations to explore. It's a decent stop for the Phantom Thieves as fans unravel another jail formed in this area before moving on.

7 Okina City

The Closest Big City To Inaba

Persona 4 takes place in the rural town of Inaba, but this doesn't mean that players don't get to explore a city from time to time. The closest urban sprawl to Inaba is Okina City, which serves as a fairly limited area for the protagonist to roam around in.

It may not be the highlight of Persona 4 , but players will appreciate this limited urban exploration after roaming around the boonies for the vast majority of their adventure. It's a glimpse into the urban chaos present in most Persona games before players eventually come back to the intimate town of Inaba.

6 Sendai

The Capital City Of Miyagi Prefecture

One of the more notable areas in Persona 5 Strikers that players will love to explore, Sendai is full of charming locales and iconic sights that are faithful to the real city. It's surprisingly big despite being a stopover, and players will love exploring the markets and seeing what's on offer here.

If a new Persona game decides to tackle a different setting, then Sendai is a perfect spot. Persona 5 Strikers leaves a strong impression of this city by the time players are done breaking into the Jail, making it rather melancholic for fans to bid farewell to this area before moving on.

5 Osaka

This Chaotic Urban Sprawl Is Visited During Summer Vacation

One of the most iconic locations in Japan that is bound to be a blast to explore in any video game, the glimpse fans get of Osaka in Persona 5 Strikers is a joy to behold. It would be impossible to incorporate the entire city into the game, but the sections that fans can explore communicate the beauty of this city's urban chaos.

The authenticity of this location is immense, to the point that anyone familiar with Osaka's landmarks will find them to be accurately depicted in the game. It houses an iconic jail and serves as the hub for a tech company that brought Emma into existence.

4 Kyoto

A Well-Known City That Makes Multiple Appearances In The Series

One of the most well-known cities in Japan, it's easy to see why Kyoto has made multiple appearances throughout the games. It serves as a road trip destination for the Phantom Thieves in Persona 5 Strikers and a vacation destination in Persona 3 that is filled to the brim with highlights.

Despite players spending the majority of their time exploring the hotel in Kyoto, it still serves as a great look at this legendary city and its inherent beauty. It helps that this vacation feels more memorable courtesy of the many hilarious moments and poignant moments with Ryoji that players experience here.

3 Sumaru City

A Fictional Seaside City Modeled After Yokohama

Fans who may find it daunting to get into Persona 2 because of a lack of life sim elements should bite the bullet and give this amazing duology a shot. The quality of these games is through the roof, to the point where long-time fans swear by the fact that Innocent Sin boasts the greatest story seen in the series.

Both games take place in Sumaru City, a haunting location modeled after Yokohama that is further enhanced in Eternal Punishment . This urban setting elevates the dark storyline of Persona 2 as players uncover certain supernatural powers at play and figure out a way to stop them.

2 Tatsumi Port Island

Serves As A Gloomy Setting

For a game that is as dark and oppressive as it comes, Tatsumi Port Island should be lauded for featuring a ton of charm without taking away from what makes the game so great in the first place. Players will become intimately familiar with this location in no time, especially if they check out its visual overhaul in Persona 3 Reload .

From the memorable dorm to the Iwatodai Station Mall and everything in between, it's easy to see why Tatsumi Port Island is one of the best cities in the series. There are many reasons why fans will shed a tear at the end of Persona 3 , and having to bid goodbye to a city they grew attached to is one major factor.

1 Tokyo

Joker Is Sent Here After His Legal Troubles

After being forced to leave his hometown following a legal case, Joker is sent to stay with Sojiro Sakura in Cafe Leblanc. This serves as a soft introduction to the urban sprawl of Tokyo that's a joy to explore and never gets old throughout an adventure that can span a hundred hours if not more.

Tokyo is brimming with several iconic landmarks, crowded markets, and other such areas that players will become quite familiar with in no time. Fans were glad that Persona 5 Royal added a third semester, giving them another excuse to spend more time in Tokyo as they unravel Maruki's dastardly plans.

item.title: Pokemon GOs Newest Poke Ball Sounds Like a Game-Changer, But Theres a Catch
item.description:
Select Pokemon GO players will have the chance to try out the game's latest Poke Ball when the Wild Area 2024 event kicks off in November. Pokemon GO players who purchase tickets to either the live event in Fukuoka, Japan, or the Global event will get the chance to catch critters using the newly-added Safari Ball, a classic type of Poke Ball making its way to Pokemon GO from the main series of games. While the Safari Ball sounds like it will be a must-use item for players looking to expand their collection during this event, it comes with a major drawback that could keep it from achieving greatness.

Pokemon GO has a history of introducing new versions of the series' many Poke Balls to the game during events. Beast Balls were introduced to the franchise in Gen 7 and were later added to Pokemon GO during Pokemon GO Fest 2022 as special Poke Balls designed specifically for catching UItra Beasts, making them ideal for catching these rare creatures but less useful for most others. While the Safari Balls are not as limited in their catching capabilities as Beast Balls, the two balls share another similar downside in Pokemon GO .

Pokemon GO's Safari Ball Makes it Easier to Catch Mons, But Only for a Limited Time

Pokemon GO's Version of the Safari Ball Follows its Main Series Counterpart's Lead

In the mainline Pokemon series, Safari Balls have been around since the Gen 1 days when they were given to players to use exclusively in the Safari Zone. Players can only use Safari Balls in the Safari Zone and they are, in turn, the only balls that can be used in the location. Although the Safari Zone and related areas have been phased out in recent generations, the Safari Ball remains a rare Poke Ball for players to show off and use as a cosmetic option when catching wild mons.

Pokemon GO takes these Poke Balls back to their roots and makes them a limited-time offering for Pokemon GO players participating in the Wild Area 2024 event. Safari Balls can only be obtained through special Timed Research given to Wild Area ticket holders, and have a rare chance to drop from PokeStops during the event for these same players. Additionally, these balls can only be used during the event and any left unused by players will disappear from their item bags after the event ends.

Why the Safari Ball is a Double-Edged Sword for Pokemon GO Players

The major draw of using Safari Balls during Pokemon GO 's Wild Area event is their increased catch rate. Similar to the mainline Safari Balls prior to Gen 8, Pokemon GO 's version will give players a much better chance of catching the player's desired critter, making them perfect for capturing some of the rare mons that will be spawning during the event. However, the limited nature and expiration date of the Safari Balls means they will only be useful for the few short days the Wild Area event runs.

Niantic has stated that Safari Balls will also be less effective outside of the location of the live Wild Area event: Fukuoka, Japan.

Like Beast Balls, Safari Balls are teed up to be a great new recurring event-only Poke Ball type that offers players participating an increased chance to catch rare mons. However, their event exclusivity holds them back from being a truly great addition to Pokemon GO . With this in mind, players participating in the Wild Area 2024 event should take full advantage of the Safari Balls they're given within the short timeframe of the event to maximize their great catching utility.

item.title: Magic: the Gathering Reveals New SpongeBob SquarePants Crossover
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Magic: the Gathering officially unveils a new SpongeBob SquarePants-themed Secret Lair set, set to release sometime next year.
  • The post did not reveal any cards set to be featured in the Secret Lair, though fans have speculated that other characters like Squidward and Sandy may appear.
  • Magic: the Gathering is set to release multiple crossover sets during 2025, including collaborations with Marvel and Final Fantasy.

Magic: the Gathering has revealed one of the TCG's newest "Secret Lair" sets coming next year, bringing SpongeBob SquarePants and his aquatic friends to the game. The beloved trading card game from Wizards of the Coast has featured a wide variety of different ways of introducing cards to the game throughout its long history. From "Universes Beyond" crossovers bringing other franchises to the card game to special promotional sets, fans have no shortage of highly-sought after Magic cards to add to their collection. Now, a certain yellow sponge is making his way to a popular product line.

Since the product line was first introduced in late 2019, Magic: the Gathering 's "Secret Lair" cards have become some of the game's most elusive and rare cards. Secret Lairs are typically only available for a limited period of time, offering players the chance to pick up exclusive alternate arts and special cards for their collections. Secret Lairs have often introduced new crossovers into the game as well, debuting special cards based on franchises like Street Fighter , Fortnite , and Hatsune Miku . Now, Magic 's next Secret Lair comes with one of the most iconic cartoon characters ever created.

Wizards of the Coast officially revealed its newest Secret Lair set on Friday, confirming that Magic: the Gathering is crossing over with SpongeBob SquarePants. The newest collaboration will feature several cards based on the beloved Nickelodeon franchise, expected to include alternate art versions of pre-existing Magic: the Gathering cards. The reveal did not give any details about the featured cards, though fans have speculated that other characters from Bikini Bottom like Squidward and Sandy may appear. The SpongeBob Secret Lair is set to release sometime during 2025.

Magic: the Gathering is Crossing Over with SpongeBob SquarePants

While Wizards of the Coast did not reveal any official cards coming with the Secret Lair, Magic: the Gathering 's past cards have led to plenty of speculation. Wizards of the Coast has already debuted several creature types that may correspond to some of SpongeBob 's characters, including Sponge, Squid, and Squirrel among others. Potential Artifact and Equipment cards have been the subject of discussion as well, with fans hoping for references to SpongeBob's spatula and other recurring SpongeBob gags like the "Magic Conch."

Magic: the Gathering 's upcoming SpongeBob collaboration is just one of several crossovers launching for the game during 2025. Wizards of the Coast has already revealed a pair of major Magic: the Gathering crossovers for next year, with both Spider-Man and Final Fantasy receiving their own expansion sets. The developer also recently showed off a Marvel -themed "Secret Lair" drop coming next month, featuring beloved heroes like Captain America and Wolverine. Fans of Magic: the Gathering 's "Universes Beyond" sets look to have plenty of fun crossovers on the way.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Free for All Has One Big Oversight
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Black Ops 6 Free for All Mode is score-based, not kill-based, sparking feedback from the community.
  • Redditor AidenT06 highlighted the oversight where assists and flashbangs accumulate points.
  • The sentiment in the discussion surrounds disappointment in changing the core essence of the popular mode.

A gamer online has noticed what appears to be an oversight in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's Free for All game mode, after winning a match in a unique way. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has only just been released, but this gamer has already found an issue with one of the game's most popular modes.

Free for All has been a staple of the Call of Duty series for many years now. With no teams and often small maps, it can prove to be one of the most hectic Call of Duty game modes, where individual skill matters above all else. There are no teammates to carry the worst player here - the cream of the crop will rise to the top. While Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 was missing some fan-favorite modes from launch, Free for All was never going to be one of them. It's simply far too popular among the franchise's community to go anywhere.

Despite how long Free for All has been a series staple, the Black Ops 6 iteration of the mode has one big oversight, as pointed out by Redditor AidenT06 after one of their games: the match rankings are score-based, not kill-based. This means that getting the most kills in a Free for All lobby doesn't necessarily guarantee the win. Assists still gather points in Free for All, as does flashbanging an enemy. One player pointed out in the thread that this could be done to offset the impact of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 killstreaks, which usually give fewer points per kill.

Black Ops 6's Free for All Mode is Score-Based and Not Kill-Based

Overall, the sentiment in this particular discussion was pretty negative about the change to the popular Black Ops 6 game mode. One user put it simply, saying, "Free for all should be pure kills, dont "fix" what aint broken." A glance at Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's pre-release material about Free for All confirms the choice as intentional, with Treyarch referring to the mode as the "first player to reach a specific number of points" wins the match. It'll be interesting to see if the studio responds to any of the discourse about Free for All, although it's very possible it just remains as it currently is.

Black Ops 6 's multiplayer offering is just getting started. There's no doubt that there will be plenty of new content and changes to existing modes that cause tons of debate in the community. Season 1 of the game doesn't currently have a release date, so gamers will have to wait and see when Treyarch reveals this. For now, gamers have Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's version of Nuketown to look forward to on November 1, which will be a remaster of the original iteration of the map.
